title: Managing Oxalate Intake
description: Oxalate, or oxalic acid, is an organic compound found in many fruits and vegetables. Although foods high in oxalates can provide health benefits, consuming oxalates in large quantities can cause issues for certain populations. Certain foods, such as spinach, and almonds, and chocolate, contain more oxalate than others. So, even though these foods can be healthy, consuming them in moderation is advised for some individuals.

tips.title: Stay Hydrated
tips.description: Drink at least 8-10 glasses of water daily to help dilute oxalates in your urine.

tips.title: Calcium Intake
tips.description: Pair high-oxalate foods with calcium-rich foods, like yogurt or cheese, to reduce absorption.

tips.title: Portion Control
tips.description: Eat smaller portions of high-oxalate foods occasionally to minimize risks.

tips.title: Regular Monitoring
tips.description: Keep a food diary to track oxalate intake and identify triggers.

tips.title: Consultation
tips.description: Consider consulting a dietitian that is well-versed in low-oxalate diets to receive tailored dietary recommendations that suit your individual needs.
